October 29

If You Want Blood, You've Got It!



Have you ever been playing Dawn of War II - Retribution and thought to yourself, ‘you know what this game needs more of? Blood.’? No. Neither have we but here at Relic we like to indulge in the unexpected, especially when it gives us an excuse to make the Ridiculously Bloody Blood Pack just in time for Halloween!

1 comments Read more

September 24

Relic Thanks Fans With Dawn of War Free Weekend, and Added Bonus Content



Even at more than 10 years old, the Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War franchise still has a strong, passionate player base, and we at Relic would like to celebrate and show our thanks! From September 24 10AM PDT through to September 27 1PM PDT, Dawn of War I and II, plus all expansions, are free to play on Steam. As well, for new recruits, or veterans looking to complete their collection, both titles and all expansions are 75% off until September 28 at 10AM PDT. As a special thank you to all our loyal players, and as a welcome to anyone new to the franchise, we’ve also added some bonuses to DoW I and II.

• The Temple of Cyrene is a brand new, official multiplayer map we’re adding into the Dawn of War I rotation. This map will be playable in DoW the Dark Crusade and Soulstorm expansions. The Temple of Cyrene sits on the blasted landscape of a world scoured clean by the Exterminatus of the Imperial Inquisition. Homeworld of Gabriel Angelos, Cyrene is now a ghost-world of ruined cities and ashen fields. Fight for supremacy amidst the remains of Cyrene’s once-mighty temples. Claim the three critical locations at the heart of the ruins or drive into enemy bases and deliver annihilation.

• In Dawn of War II, we’re giving away four free sets of Wargear; The Vanguard, Sniper, Sternguard, and Destroyer, to equip in the main campaign that were previously only available as pre-order DLC, or as rare loot drops. Now everyone will be able to equip items like the Veteran’s Grenades, Blade of Ulyus, Armor of the Destroyer, and many more to complete your sets!

21 comments Read more

About This Game

Deep under the central desert of Kronus, a vast honeycomb of skull-lined tunnels and funeral chambers house the awakening Necron menace. Eons ago, these were the boulevards and squares of a great necropolis built to house the bones of the races who had fallen to the Necrons, and ultimately were where the Necrons themselves retire to spend eternity. Over millions of years, sand and rock had covered it all until ill-fated excavations awoke the deathless.
Play any of seven races, striving for control over Kronus. Take other races' strongholds by winning challenging battles on various maps individually associated with the respective strongholds.

  • New Races
    Take command of two new playable races: Tau and Necron to unleash massive carnage across the frontlines of battle.

  • Expanded multiplayer
    Dominate opponents online across 12 new multiplayer maps - with up to 8 players battling it out for supremacy.

  • Deep single player campaign
    Conquer the planet of Kronus any way you choose - leading any one of seven races on an epic crusade through an all-new, non-linear single player campaign where you can experience unique storylines from each race's perspective.

  • Customization
    Customize your hero's weapons, items and abilities as he grows in power and influence. Personalize your army with a variety of insignias, squad colors, banners and names.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum: Windows 2000/XP, 2.0 Ghz Intel Pentium 4, AMD Athlon XP or equivalent processor, 512 MB RAM, 3.5 GB free hard drive space, 64 MB DirectX 9.0b compatible AGP video card with Hardware Transformation and lighting, 16-bit DirectX 9.0b compatible sound card, DirectX 9.0c, Mouse, Keyboard
    Recommended: 2.4 GHz Intel Pentium 4 or equivalent, 512 MB system RAM (required for 8-player multiplayer games), nVidia GeForce 3 or equivalent with 64 MB of Video RAM , Sound Blaster X-Fi Series
    Required for Multiplayer: Internet: Cable modem, DSL modem, or better for online multiplayer play; Network: LAN or broadband WAN
READ MORE

hkennyrules101
311 products in account
24 reviews
Recommended
41.8 hrs on record
Posted: August 29
Pros:
+ Solid storyline
+ World conquest for a main campaign... as any of the playable races
+ Vast array of playable races, all with different playstyles
+ Bug-free
+ Classic RTS Gameplay
+ THIS is how a Dawn of War game should be done
+ Multiplayer is still fantastic

Cons:
- None, really.

Overall: This, imo, is the pinnacle for the first Dawn of War game. Soulstorm is fun, yes, but this game came first, hit all the right notes, and Soulstorm just tried to mimic it. Being able to play the campaign for world conquest with any playable race is fantastic, and the addition of so many races makes multiplayer even more frantic. By far my favorite in the Dawn of War games.

Bottom Line: Worth playing and replaying... and replaying... and replaying...

Play as one of several factions as you try to take over a strategic map one area at a time, fighting tactical RTS battles for each one you attack or have to defend. Good variety in the factions and a decent amount of replayability.

This one is quite good, even if it is getting old.
